title: Toshiko Akiyoshi discography
text: Since her debut recording for <a href="Norgran%20Records">Norgran Records</a> in 1954, jazz pianist, composer, arranger and big band leader <a href="Toshiko%20Akiyoshi">Toshiko Akiyoshi</a> has recorded continuously – almost exclusively as a leader of small <a href="jazz%20combo">jazz combo</a>s and of her <a href="big%20band">big band</a>s – averaging one studio <a href="album">album</a> release per year for well over 50 years. She has also recorded several live albums in solo, small combo and big band settings, including three big band concert videos. Akiyoshi has released multiple albums for <a href="Victor%20Entertainment">Victor</a> / <a href="Bertelsmann%20Music%20Group">BMG</a>, <a href="Columbia%20Music%20Entertainment">Nippon Columbia</a>, <a href="Toshiba">Toshiba</a>, Discomate, <a href="Nippon%20Crown">Nippon Crown</a> and other labels in Japan and for Norgran / <a href="Verve%20Records">Verve</a>, <a href="RCA%20Records">RCA</a>, <a href="Columbia%20Records">Columbia</a> / <a href="Sony%20Music%20Entertainment">Sony</a>, <a href="Concord%20Records">Concord</a> and her own Ascent label in the US. All of her big band recordings and nearly all of her other early works have been re-issued on <a href="Compact%20Disc">CD</a>s over the years.
